title: Is my novel's idea a good one? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your description is not much to go by — although I would refrain from saying it’s about World War 1 if you’ve only taken inspiration from the weapons and warfare. Saying you’re inspired by the world wars would be better. I can’t really say if the idea’s a good one, though, since you haven’t mentioned the slightest bit of a plot.

Your asking the wrong question, in my opinion. I’m not a gamer. If you asked me if I would like a book where most of the action took place in a game, I would say no. But I hugely enjoyed Ready Player One. Because the characters and action engaged me. A good writer could make a visit to the dentist office worth reading. A bad writer could make Florence Nightingales life unreadable. The Idea is the least part of any book.
